summary: This document is a deposit account opening application from Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas (DBTCA) detailing various account types and requirements for establishing a banking relationship. It includes information on customer identification policies, joint account disclosures, and compliance responsibilities for non-US individuals and organizations.
keyFacts: The document outlines the requirements for opening various types of accounts, including checking and money market accounts.
It emphasizes the importance of customer identification to combat money laundering and terrorist financing.
There are specific obligations for clients to notify the bank of any changes in personal or institutional information.
The document includes terms regarding joint accounts and the rights of account holders.
It mentions the need for compliance with tax obligations and regulatory reporting for non-US individuals and organizations.
